# Installation Guide

This page shows the fastest way to get ManipulaPy on your machine and explains the optional extras published on PyPIÂ â€” they mirror the names you see in pyproject.toml (gpuâ€‘cuda11 & co.).

All commands assume you are inside a fresh virtual environment (python -m venv or Conda). ManipulaPy supports PythonÂ 3.8â€¯â€“â€¯3.12 on Linux, macOS (CPUâ€‘only), and Windows/WSL2.

## System requirements

=================== ============================================================= Component Minimum / recommended =================== ============================================================= CPU x86â€‘64 or AppleÂ Silicon (runs in Rosetta) RAM 4Â GBÂ minÂ / 8Â GBÂ recommended GPUÂ (optional) NVIDIA CUDAÂ 11.8â€¯/â€¯12.4 or AMD ROCmÂ 5.7 =================== =============================================================

## Quick install (CPUâ€‘only)

If you do not need GPU acceleration right away:

pip install manipulapy

This brings in all core features â€” kinematics, dynamics, perception, trajectory planning, PyBullet sim, OpenCV, Torch, scikitâ€‘learn, etc. Nothing else to add.

## GPU extras

ManipulaPy ships several â€œextrasâ€ so you can choose the CUDA flavour that matches your driver:

========================== When to use Command ========================== â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”- CUDAÂ 11.x (470+ drivers) Most LTS distro packages pip install manipulapy[gpu-cuda11] CUDAÂ 12.x (535+ drivers) Latest NVIDIA toolkits / UbuntuÂ 24.04 pip install manipulapy[gpu-cuda12] AMDÂ ROCmÂ 5.6+ Recent Radeon/MI cards pip install manipulapy[gpu-rocm] LegacyÂ PyCUDA Prefer pycuda API over CuPy pip install manipulapy[gpu-pycuda] Metaâ€‘extra (defaults CUDA11) Installs CuPyÂ 11 build pip install manipulapy[gpu] ========================== â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-

After the install you can verify CUDA access:

import cupy as cp print(â€œCUDA available:â€, cp.cuda.is_available()) print(â€œDevice count:â€, cp.cuda.runtime.getDeviceCount())

## Development & docs

  • Editable dev install (tests, Black, MyPy, coverage):

    git clone [https://github.com/boelnasr/ManipulaPy.git](https://github.com/boelnasr/ManipulaPy.git) cd ManipulaPy pip install -e .[dev]

  • Build the documentation locally:

    pip install manipulapy[docs] sphinx-build -b html docs docs/_build/html

## Conda & Docker

ManipulaPy is mirrored on condaâ€‘forge and as readyâ€‘made Docker images:

# Conda CPU build

conda install -c conda-forge manipulapy

# Docker (CPU)

docker pull manipulapy/manipulapy:cpu-latest

# Docker (GPU, CUDAÂ 12)

docker pull manipulapy/manipulapy:cuda12-latest docker run â€“gpus all -it manipulapy/manipulapy:cuda12-latest

## Troubleshooting

  • ImportError: No module named â€˜cupyâ€™ â€“ install the matching extra (see table).

  • CUDA out of memory â€“ lower batch sizes or hide the GPU:

    CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=â€â€ python your_script.py # forces CPU fallback

  • Windows build errors â€“ ensure MicrosoftÂ C++ Build Tools are installed.

## Update / Upgrade

pip install â€“upgrade manipulapy # upgrades the core pip install â€“upgrade â€œmanipulapy[gpu-cuda12]â€ # upgrade with extras
